Name: attrelid
Description: the table this column belongs to

Name: attname
Description: the column name

Name: atttypid
Description: the data type of this column (zero for a dropped column)

Name: attlen
Description: a copy of pg_type.typlen of this column's type

Name: attnum
Description: the number of the column. ordinary columns are numbered from 1 up. system columns, such as ctid, have (arbitrary) negative numbers.

Name: attcacheoff
Description: always -1 in storage, but when loaded into a row descriptor in memory this might be updated to cache the offset of the attribute within the row

Name: atttypmod
Description: atttypmod records type-specific data supplied at table creation time (for example, the maximum length of a varchar column). it is passed to type-specific input functions and length coercion functions. the value will generally be -1 for types that do not need atttypmod.

Name: attndims
Description: number of dimensions, if the column is an array type; otherwise 0. (presently, the number of dimensions of an array is not enforced, so any nonzero value effectively means "it's an array".)

Name: attbyval
Description: a copy of pg_type.typbyval of this column's type

Name: attalign
Description: a copy of pg_type.typalign of this column's type

Name: attstorage
Description: normally a copy of pg_type.typstorage of this column's type. for toast-able data types, this can be altered after column creation to control storage policy.

Name: attcompression
Description: the current compression method of the column. typically this is '\0' to specify use of the current default setting (see default_toast_compression). otherwise, 'p' selects pglz compression, while 'l' selects lz4 compression. however, this field is ignored whenever attstorage does not allow compression.

Name: attnotnull
Description: this represents a not-null constraint.

Name: atthasdef
Description: this column has a default expression or generation expression, in which case there will be a corresponding entry in the pg_attrdef catalog that actually defines the expression. (check attgenerated to determine whether this is a default or a generation expression.)

Name: atthasmissing
Description: this column has a value which is used where the column is entirely missing from the row, as happens when a column is added with a non-volatile default value after the row is created. the actual value used is stored in the attmissingval column.

Name: attidentity
Description: if a zero byte (''), then not an identity column. otherwise, a = generated always, d = generated by default.

Name: attgenerated
Description: if a zero byte (''), then not a generated column. otherwise, s = stored. (other values might be added in the future.)

Name: attisdropped
Description: this column has been dropped and is no longer valid. a dropped column is still physically present in the table, but is ignored by the parser and so cannot be accessed via sql.

Name: attislocal
Description: this column is defined locally in the relation. note that a column can be locally defined and inherited simultaneously.

Name: attinhcount
Description: the number of direct ancestors this column has. a column with a nonzero number of ancestors cannot be dropped nor renamed.

Name: attstattarget
Description: attstattarget controls the level of detail of statistics accumulated for this column by analyze. a zero value indicates that no statistics should be collected. a negative value says to use the system default statistics target. the exact meaning of positive values is data type-dependent. for scalar data types, attstattarget is both the target number of "most common values" to collect, and the target number of histogram bins to create.

Name: attcollation
Description: the defined collation of the column, or zero if the column is not of a collatable data type

Name: attacl
Description: column-level access privileges, if any have been granted specifically on this column

Name: attoptions
Description: attribute-level options, as "keyword=value" strings

Name: attfdwoptions
Description: attribute-level foreign data wrapper options, as "keyword=value" strings

Name: attmissingval
Description: this column has a one element array containing the value used when the column is entirely missing from the row, as happens when the column is added with a non-volatile default value after the row is created. the value is only used when atthasmissing is true. if there is no value the column is null.
